primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the human soul from the 'pit of corruption' (shadow/judgment) to a state of 'peace and joy' (light/grace) through the divine act of forgiveness.

thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back
I am he that blotteth out thy transgressions
delivered it from the pit of corruption

zender.identificatie: God as the Source of Holiness and Mercy
tekstueel_bewijs: him who has called you out of darkness

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a divine action.

tekstueel_bewijs: contemplating... the bright light of his dying Savior's love
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ/Cross is the instrumental Helper/Mediator.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that 'melts the stoniest heart'.

tekstueel_bewijs: old antagonist of the human soul... selfishness
acts of treason against the holiness of God
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as 'deadly disease' and 'treason' that creates an impassable 'shadow of judgment' which the human subject cannot overcome alone.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to the light (social justice/racial harmony).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Nation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests that the 'sickness' of race prejudice is a symptom of the 'shadow' and that walking in the 'light' of forgiveness should change how one views 'our common humanity'.

God has put what was between him and his Maker behind the Lord's back
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I visited the home of the painter

voorbeelden: problems to which we ought to bring humility
I did not know that there was any actual basis
The years have taught their lesson
we could not and cannot approach God as we are

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human INCOMPETENCE (non-pouvoir) to escape the shadow and God's absolute POWER (pouvoir) to deliver and blot out transgressions.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Judgment) to the realization of ~S1 (the weight of debt) and finally to S1 (Grace) through the divine act of ~S2 (forgetting/blotting out).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'glorious nonsense'—the act of putting sins behind His back where they no longer exist.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Judgment is described as a 'pit of corruption' and 'deadly disease'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the primary agent of salvation. Human effort is presented as failed (selfishness/treason), and grace is presented as an objective change in status (debt settled) rather than a reward for moral improvement.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Ethical exhortation without explicit link to Spirit
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we ought to bring humility as well as conviction

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: thou hast in love to my soul delivered it
we could not and cannot approach God as we are

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; rather, the 'old people' and the 'forgiven man' are used as witnesses to God's action.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of shadow and light perfectly integrates the diagnosis of sin with the proclamation of grace.
spanning_punten: The transition from the 'Night Watch' painting to racial issues is slightly abrupt but structurally serves the 'contrast' theme.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The debt for those who own Christ... is all wiped away. The debt is settled.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father and the Son; the Spirit's work is implied in the 'melting' of the heart.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Extremely serious; sin is an 'antagonist' and a 'scarlet shadow'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of the primary program (Salvation), and the human is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more emphasis on the 'Vouloir' (the new motivation) of the believer in the secondary program.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'outward living' more explicitly to the 'marvelous light' as a fruit of the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The 'pit of corruption' provides the necessary contrast for the 'marvelous light'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly precedes and grounds Ethics (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful homiletical structure that uses aesthetic metaphors to anchor deep structural grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Rembrandt metaphor, Greimasian analysis reveals that the metaphor serves to establish the 'Axis of Power' between God and Sin.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on Hezekiah's prayer; this analysis shows how the preacher universalizes the actantial roles for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'nonsense' of God putting sins behind His back is actually a semiotic 'Subject-switch' where God removes the Object (Sin) from the field of vision entirely.

volledige_subject_lijst: We (sinned, forsaken, live inward, worship things)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' conditional trap, maintaining a causal structure of grace.
